title: How to Add OneDrive to the Files App on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Sign into the OneDrive app.
steps.content: Sign into the OneDrive app. Before you can add OneDrive to the Files app , you'll need to download the app from the App Store and sign into your Microsoft account . If you haven't already, set up OneDrive .

steps.title: Open the Files app .
steps.content: Open the Files app . This looks like a blue folder with a white background. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Browse tab.
steps.content: Tap the Browse tab. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. If you're redirected to a folder, tap Browse again until you see the Locations header.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . You'll see switches next to the locations.

steps.title: Toggle on "OneDrive".
steps.content: Toggle on "OneDrive". The switch will turn green.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This is in the top-right corner. You can now save files to OneDrive via the Files app.

steps.title: Navigate to the file you want to save.
steps.content: Navigate to the file you want to save. This could be a PDF, photo, video, or another file.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This is usually at the top-right or bottom of the file.

steps.title: Tap Save to Files.
steps.content: Tap Save to Files . You can find this at the bottom of the Share menu.

steps.title: Navigate to the OneDrive folder.
steps.content: Navigate to the OneDrive folder. If the OneDrive folder doesn't open automatically, tap the back arrow in the top-left corner until you return to the Browse page. Then, select OneDrive .

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This is in the top-right corner. The file will be saved to your connected OneDrive account.
